dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1684 IH: Foreign Spill Protection Act of 2015

action.action-desc: Mr. Curbelo of Florida (for himself, Mr. Murphy of Florida, Mr. Young of Alaska, Mr. Sires, and Ms. Ros-Lehtinen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 and the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to impose penalties and provide for the recovery of removal costs and damages in connection with certain discharges of oil from foreign offshore units, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Spill Protection Act of 2015.

section.header: Liability of owners and operators of foreign offshore units
section.text: Section 1002 of the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 (33 U.S.C. 2702) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: In any case in which there is a discharge, or substantial threat of discharge, of oil from a foreign offshore unit that reaches or threatens to reach the navigable waters or adjoining shorelines or the exclusive economic zone, the owner or operator of the facility—

paragraph.text: is liable for the removal costs and damages specified in subsection (b) that result from such incident; and
shall be treated as a responsible party with respect to the incident for the purposes of this Act in the same manner as a responsible party for an offshore facility.

section.header: Penalties for discharge of oil from foreign offshore units
section.text: Section 311(b) of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act (33 U.S.C. 1321(b)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Discharges of oil reaching navigable waters
subparagraph.text: In any case in which there is a discharge of oil from a foreign offshore unit that reaches the navigable waters of the United States, adjoining shorelines, or waters of the contiguous zone—

clause.text: the discharge shall be subject to the prohibition in paragraph (3); and
the owner or operator of the unit shall be subject to the penalties established under this subsection.

subparagraph.text: In this paragraph, the term foreign offshore unit has the meaning given that term in section 1001 of the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 (33 U.S.C. 2701).

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply with respect to a discharge, or substantial threat of discharge, of oil occurring after the date of enactment of this Act.
